reviewText:
This...is unbelievably BROKEN.

The game touts that You won't even beat the first level". What it should say is "you won't even give a damn about beating the game after playing the first level".

I like challenging games. The price was right
date: so I thought to myself: "Why not? It's only $1.79!"\nWell
recommended: I wish I would have avoided this game like a fart-filled elevator.\nTHIS GAME....is bad. Not bad like "ugh
hoursPlayed: what a waste of time" bad
voteText: but "the developer trolling Steam" bad.\n\nThe game describes itself as an "80's challenge"
helpfulPercent: which it is in the sense of comparing it to a broken Atari game with bad controls. You literally can die within a second of starting the game
votesHelpful: and the controls and collision detection are so damn awful that you'll laugh to keep from firing off a string of expletives. Also: there's NO SCORE and NO FINISH LINE
votesTotal: so there's NO POINT in playing. Why play a game with absolutely zero objectives other than to stay alive?\n\nTo top it off
votesFunny: there's no option menu. NONE. You can't change any settings (because it only has two: suck
column16: you can't map the controls (control being used very loosely)
column17:
and the MOST egregious omission is that there is NO WAY to exit the game without a CTRL ALT DEL. What a joke.

I wish I'd spent the $1.79 on a bag of potato chips rather than on this pile of cow chips. Epic Games should sue the developer for misrepresenting this rip-off as an actual "game". This garbage defiled the Unreal Engine to the point of it being a crime.

Please go to Youtube and look up "Airlock" for the Atari 2600 by Data Age. THAT is better than this.

DO. NOT. BUY."
column21: 358 of 371 people (96%) found this review helpful 49 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Well, first bug is when the EULA pop up and you see steamstore home page instead of it. Ok, I signed steam page, fine EULA for me.

Next problem is resolution - it is fixed and it is low (kinda 1366x768).

After that finally the game. Ok, how do I control it? Mouse doesn't work, arrows as well, appeared that A-D keys move your character sideways. Can you change these keys? No. Are there any options at all? No. Is there exit button for this game? No, you have to Alt+F4.

About gameplay. It was claimed to be challenging, at the end the challenge is game design. There are no clear hitboxes, fancy coat make you unable to tell if you hit something or just was suddenly blowed off, some levels are under construction (level 10 or 12, for example).

By pressing random buttons you can got general idea that q is kinda pause, c - first person view, caps lock - ghost run (oh, it's not a ghost, it's player 2 to be controlled by arrows, ffs), n - next level, x meant to do something but it doesn't, 1...9 teleport you to level with the same number, o teleport you to level 12 and i to level 10. After you die you can spawn tons of warlocks at level 10 with the same i, also this level is not designed to be beaten at all. I didn't find jump button yet..

You are expected to run, but to be honest, the character is running on the same place, and just some objects run towards you. Not really a problem, but this looks ugly.

Optimisation... this game used up to 1300Mb of my GPU RAM, which is insane for such a simple game.

Overall the game is raw, badly tested and unfinished, claimed challenge is not a challenge so don't get baited. By the way, what is the key to jump?

If you like this game then you'll like that ♥♥♥♥♥♥ aeroplane game that came out a while ago and got taken off soon after.

reviewText:
I loaded up the game and was immediately thrust into a situation which I, unfortunately, have been in myself one too many times.  I was running on the spot as what I can only assume were large pieces of ravioli edged closer to my screen, but there were too many and I was overwhelmed by the pasta-esque dastards.

Also, the game has this cool feature where there is no 'exit' or 'quit' option in the menu, so no matter how much you want to leave, you cannot.

Pretty cool game.  I'd recommend it if you also enjoy swallowing gravel, or sucking farts out of your father's ♥♥♥.

1/10

reviewText:
The Bad:
1.  Starting the game does something weird with vid cards showing some backwards use of the engine to reboot the display driver or something causing it to lose signal.
2.  Upon first boot this terrible 2 second loop or so of sound kept repeating, thought the game was broken but that is the music that sounds like a horse running in circles on an elevator driven insane by the elevator music, the horse now spends eternity running in circles desperate to escape.
3.  There is no game, you stand in place and the animation runs but the character never moves.
4.  Nothing is explained, even random button mashing yields results that still dont help understand what is happening.
5.  There is NO way to quit the game, much like the man cursed with running, it seems the player could be cursed with paying it forever or just hit alt-F4 to close it...

The Good:
Playing as a business man cursed to run forever you enter  world that looks like Mad Max crossed with pyramids.  Pretty cool atmosphere.  The character looks kind of deus ex like which adds a cyber punk kind of feeling.  For those who say the game is impossible, the levels are beatable, though why bother is a diff question.

What is real strange is the developer Albert Espin put his name all over the game, even here on the store page.   For a game so bad it was removed from steam, its odd someone put their name all over it.  The internet never forgets, if this person tries getting a job somewhere in gaming, that might not work out.  The ideas seem nice but this person might make a better creative designer than a game developer.  Would be nice to see an accidental runner 2 with these themes that is actually a game.  Many may hate hearing this but for the developer to be forgiven, they should make a no holds barred sequel that is playable.  The dev should play lococycle which has the spirit and mechanics the dev may find useful for that sequel or one of us could gift it to him.  :D

This game could be cool if it was a game...
Rating:  0/10  Value:  $0.00

reviewText:
At the point of writing, this is quite easily the worst game ever to be released on Steam.

Previous contenders, like the classic Stalin vs Martians" or more recent record breakers and title holders like "Air Control" can't hold a candle to this pile of manure.

It's almost like it was purposefully designed to be the worst game imaginable just to showcase how incredibly broken the Greenlight process currently is. Like signing up a cat at a diploma mill to expose its diplomas as fraudulent ... or in this case
date: not a cat but a brain dead skunk.\n\nIf this was your goal
recommended: congratulations Albert Espín. You have achieved all that and more!\n\nThe complete lack of an exit button or a way to close the game from inside of itself was a nice touch
hoursPlayed: too. That's what gamer hell must be like."
voteText: April 30, 2015

reviewText:
I cannot deny that Accidental Runner possesses many terrible, terrible kusoge qualities.  I also cannot deny that it is somewhat addictive, nor that it has a half-a***ed charm!  I've only beaten the first level so far, but would eventually like to challenge myself to the remaining levels, which seem even more torturous than the houseplant stampede.

About the hitboxes?  They're not broken; you are broken, you imperfect human.  Throw your meat-parts to the wind and join the cyborg collective (discarding your sense of aesthetics might help, too).

♥♥♥RECOMMENDED!  For cheap or freeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!♥♥♥

Wow!  My little review has upset 10 peeps so far!  Pretty impressive, considering you can't even buy the game here anymore.
